page.title: 08POOLE FARM,CROWNHILL
page.content: Poole Farm which belongs to Plymouth City Council, covers 32 acres. The farmer also rents 146 adjoining acres from the Property Services Agency. He runs it as a commercial stock farm. Casual labour is employed at harvest time. About 8O home bred pedigree South Devon cattle are kept for beef and about 12O in-lamb ewes are bought in Autumn. There are sufficient out-buildings to over-winter most animals under cover. The farmer aims to be self-sufficient in hay, silage and kale, but buys barley and cattle nuts. He hires machinery to make big-bale silage. The farm is surrounded by residential areas and it is used for military training so farm animals are quite used to people but trespassers do damage fences and disturb wildlife. At present there are no plans to develop the land .
